001package io.jstach.ezkv.json5;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.InputStream;
005import java.io.InputStreamReader;
006import java.io.StringReader;
007import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
008import java.util.List;
009import java.util.Objects;
010import java.util.Optional;
011import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
012
013import org.jspecify.annotations.Nullable;
014
015import io.jstach.ezkv.json5.internal.JSONParser;
016import io.jstach.ezkv.json5.internal.JSONParserOptions;
017import io.jstach.ezkv.json5.internal.JSONParserOptions.DuplicateBehavior;
018import io.jstach.ezkv.json5.internal.JSONStringify;
019import io.jstach.ezkv.json5.internal.JSONValue;
020import io.jstach.ezkv.json5.internal.JSONValue.JSONArray;
021import io.jstach.ezkv.json5.internal.JSONValue.JSONBoolean;
022import io.jstach.ezkv.json5.internal.JSONValue.JSONNull;
023import io.jstach.ezkv.json5.internal.JSONValue.JSONNumber;
024import io.jstach.ezkv.json5.internal.JSONValue.JSONObject;
025import io.jstach.ezkv.json5.internal.JSONValue.JSONString;
026import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValues;
027import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesMedia;
028import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource;
029import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.Variables;
030
031// @formatter:off
032/**
033 * Parses <a href="https://json5.org/">JSON5</a> to KeyValues. The {@link #parser()} can
034 * also be used for strict JSON as JSON5 is a true superset.
035 * <p>
036 * The constants in this class are important and describe parameters that can be set on the
037 * {@link KeyValuesResource}.
038 * </p>
039 * <p>
040 * JSON is not flat and is more of a tree where as EZKV KeyValues are and only
041 * support string values. <strong>Thus the parser flattens the JSON
042 * based on some heuristics.</strong> JSON objects are easy to flatten but
043 * JSON arrays need special handling.
044 * </p>
045 *
046 * Here is an example of the default flattening:
047 *
048 * {@snippet lang = json :
049 *      {
050 *              "a": {
051 *                      "b": [1, 2.0, {"c": 3}],
052 *                      "d": "value"
053 *              }
054 *      }
055 * }
056 *
057 * Here is the corresponding key values (notice duplicates):
058 *
059 * {@snippet lang = properties :
060 * a.b=1
061 * a.b=2.0
062 * a.b.c=3
063 * a.d=value
064 * }
065 *
066 * <p>
067 * Because EZKV supports duplicates and order matters the data is not lost but this
068 * might be confusing. Another option is to generate array indices in the keys.
069 * </p>
070 *
071 * Assume we load a resource with the previous JSON like:
072 *
073 * {@snippet lang = properties :
074 *
075 * _load_a=classpath:/a.json5?_param_json5_arraykey=array
076 *
077 * }
078 *
079 * We will get flattened key values that look like:
080 *
081 * {@snippet lang = properties :
082 * a.b[0]=1
083 * a.b[1]=2.0
084 * a.b[2].c=3
085 * a.d=value
086 * }
087 *
088 * Because both formats may not be what you want you might want to use a
089 * {@linkplain KeyValuesFilter filter}  to clean up the results.
090 *
091 * <p>
092 * This module does have a service loader registration. If you do not wish to use the
093 * Service Loader you can add an instance of this class to
094 * {@link io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesSystem.Builder}.
095 * </p>
096 *
097 * @apiNote This is not included with the core ezkv module because JSON5 is still evolving
098 * and likely to keep changing.
099 * @see #ARRAY_KEY_PARAM
100 * @see #SEPARATOR_PARAM
101 *
102 */
103// @formatter:on
104
105public final class JSON5KeyValuesMedia implements KeyValuesMedia {
106
107        /**
108         * The media type is {@value #MEDIA_TYPE} and not <code>application/json</code>
109         * however this media will work for normal json.
110         */
111        public static final String MEDIA_TYPE = "application/json5";
112
113        /**
114         * The file ext is {@value #FILE_EXT} and not <code>json</code> however this media
115         * will work for <code>json</code> extension.
116         */
117        public static final String FILE_EXT = "json5";
118        static final String JSON_FILE_EXT = "json";
119        static final String JSON_MEDIA_TYPE = "application/json";
120
121        // @formatter:off
122        /**
123         * This parameter controls the array key naming scheme
124         * and is set with {@link KeyValuesResource#parameters()}.
125         * The two values are
126         *
127         * {@value #ARRAY_KEY_DUPLICATE_VALUE} (default) and
128         * {@value #ARRAY_KEY_ARRAY_VALUE}.
129         *
130         * An example is:
131         * {@snippet lang = properties :
132         *
133         * _load_a=classpath:/a.json5?_param_json5_arraykey=array
134         *
135         * }
136         */
137        // @formatter:on
138        public static final String ARRAY_KEY_PARAM = "json5_arraykey";
139
140        private static final String ARRAY_KEY_ALIAS = "json_arraykey";
141
142        /**
143         * Will output array keys using array notation like <code>a[0]</code> instead of the
144         * default which is duplicating the keys.
145         */
146        public static final String ARRAY_KEY_ARRAY_VALUE = "array";
147
148        // @formatter:off
149        /**
150         * Will duplicate keys for array entries.
151         * For example <code>{ "a" : [ 1, 2 ] }</code>
152         * will be
153         * {@snippet lang = properties :
154         * a=1
155         * a=2
156         * }
157         */
158        // @formatter:on
159        public static final String ARRAY_KEY_DUPLICATE_VALUE = "duplicate";
160
161        /**
162         * Configures the separator by {@link KeyValuesResource#parameters()} with the key
163         * {@value #SEPARATOR_PARAM} and is by default {@value #DEFAULT_SEPARATOR}.
164         */
165        public static final String SEPARATOR_PARAM = "json5_separator";
166
167        private static final String SEPARATOR_PARAM_ALIAS = "json_separator";
168
169        /**
170         * The default JSON path separator.
171         */
172        public static final String DEFAULT_SEPARATOR = ".";
173
174        // @formatter:off
175        /**
176         * Configures whether or not to use the raw JSON5 number found
177         * instead of the Java converted number in {@link KeyValuesResource#parameters()} with the key
178         * {@value #NUMBER_RAW_PARAM} and is by default <code>false</code>.
179         * An example is if one used hexadecimal <code>-0xC0FFEE</code> it normally
180         * would be converted to an integer.
181         * {@snippet lang = json :
182         * { "number" : -0xC0FFEE}
183         * }
184         * Will yield key values:
185         * {@snippet lang = properties :
186         * # Normally the below would happen
187         * # number=-12648430
188         * # But will now be
189         * number=-0xC0FFEE
190         * }
191         * <strong>Note that exponents in JSON5 work different than in Java so
192         * downstream configuration parsing will have to deal with this
193         * if this is turned on but otherwise most of JSON5 number
194         * format is a compatible subset of Java.
195         * </strong>
196         */
197        // @formatter:on
198        public static final String NUMBER_RAW_PARAM = "json5_number_raw";
199
200        private static final String NUMBER_RAW_ALIAS = "json_number_raw";
201
202        /**
203         * For service loader.
204         */
205        public JSON5KeyValuesMedia() {
206        }
207
208        @Override
209        public String getMediaType() {
210                return MEDIA_TYPE;
211        }
212
213        @Override
214        public @Nullable String getFileExt() {
215                return FILE_EXT;
216        }
217
218        @Override
219        public Parser parser() {
220                return JSON5KeyValuesParser.parser;
221        }
222
223        @Override
224        public Parser parser(Variables parameters) {
225                var arrayKeyOption = Param.ARRAY.requireElse(parameters, ArrayKeyOption::parse, ArrayKeyOption.defaults());
226                String separator = Param.SEPARATOR.requireElse(parameters, DEFAULT_SEPARATOR);
227                boolean rawNumber = Param.NUMBER.requireElse(parameters, Boolean::parseBoolean, false);
228                return new JSON5KeyValuesParser(JSON5KeyValuesParser.defaultOptions, arrayKeyOption, separator, rawNumber);
229        }
230
231        @SuppressWarnings("ImmutableEnumChecker")
232        enum Param implements Variables.Parameter {
233
234                ARRAY(ARRAY_KEY_PARAM, ARRAY_KEY_ALIAS), SEPARATOR(SEPARATOR_PARAM, SEPARATOR_PARAM_ALIAS),
235                NUMBER(NUMBER_RAW_PARAM, NUMBER_RAW_ALIAS);
236
237                private final List<String> keys;
238
239                private Param(String key, String alias) {
240                        this.keys = List.of(key, alias);
241                }
242
243                @Override
244                public List<String> keys() {
245                        return this.keys;
246                }
247
248        }
249
250        @Override
251        public Formatter formatter() {
252                return new JSON5KeyValuesFormatter();
253        }
254
255        @Override
256        public Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByMediaType(String mediaType) {
257                var json5 = KeyValuesMedia.super.findByMediaType(mediaType);
258                if (json5.isPresent()) {
259                        return json5;
260                }
261                if (JSON_MEDIA_TYPE.equalsIgnoreCase(mediaType)) {
262                        return Optional.of(this);
263                }
264                return Optional.empty();
265        }
266
267        @Override
268        public boolean hasFileExt(String filename) {
269                boolean json5 = KeyValuesMedia.super.hasFileExt(filename);
270                if (json5) {
271                        return true;
272                }
273                return filename.endsWith("." + JSON_FILE_EXT);
274        }
275
276        static enum ArrayKeyOption {
277
278                DUPLICATE(ARRAY_KEY_DUPLICATE_VALUE), //
279                ARRAY(ARRAY_KEY_ARRAY_VALUE),;
280
281                private final String value;
282
283                private ArrayKeyOption(String value) {
284                        this.value = value;
285                }
286
287                static ArrayKeyOption defaults() {
288                        return ArrayKeyOption.DUPLICATE;
289                }
290
291                void set(BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
292                        consumer.accept(ARRAY_KEY_PARAM, value);
293                }
294
295                static ArrayKeyOption parse(@Nullable String input) {
296                        if (input == null) {
297                                return defaults();
298                        }
299                        for (var a : ArrayKeyOption.values()) {
300                                if (a.value.equalsIgnoreCase(input)) {
301                                        return a;
302                                }
303                        }
304                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Bad ArrayKeyOption: " + input);
305                }
306
307        }
308
309        static class JSON5KeyValuesFormatter implements Formatter {
310
311                @Override
312                public void format(Appendable appendable, KeyValues kvs) throws IOException {
313                        JSONObject object = new JSONObject();
314                        for (var kv : kvs) {
315                                object.merge(kv.key(), new JSONString(kv.value()));
316                        }
317                        String json = JSONStringify.toString(object, 2);
318                        appendable.append(json);
319                }
320
321        }
322
323        static class JSON5KeyValuesParser implements Parser {
324
325                private final JSONParserOptions options;
326
327                private final ArrayKeyOption arrayKeyOption;
328
329                private final String separator;
330
331                private final boolean rawNumber;
332
333                static final JSONParserOptions defaultOptions = new JSONParserOptions.Builder()
334                        .duplicateBehaviour(DuplicateBehavior.DUPLICATE)
335                        .build();
336
337                static final JSON5KeyValuesParser parser = new JSON5KeyValuesParser(defaultOptions, ArrayKeyOption.defaults(),
338                                DEFAULT_SEPARATOR, false);
339
340                public JSON5KeyValuesParser(JSONParserOptions options, ArrayKeyOption arrayKeyOption, String separator,
341                                boolean rawNumber) {
342                        super();
343                        this.options = options;
344                        this.arrayKeyOption = Objects.requireNonNull(arrayKeyOption);
345                        this.separator = separator;
346                        this.rawNumber = rawNumber;
347                }
348
349                @Override
350                public void parse(InputStream input, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) throws IOException {
351                        JSONParser parser = new JSONParser(new InputStreamReader(input, StandardCharsets.UTF_8), options);
352                        parse(parser, consumer);
353
354                }
355
356                @Override
357                public void parse(String input, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
358                        JSONParser parser = new JSONParser(new StringReader(input), options);
359                        parse(parser, consumer);
360                }
361
362                private void parse(JSONParser parser, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
363                        JSONValue json = parser.topValueOrNull();
364                        switch (json) {
365                                case JSONObject o -> {
366                                        flattenJsonObject(o, "", consumer);
367                                }
368                                case JSONArray a -> {
369                                        flattenJsonArray(a, "", consumer);
370                                }
371                                case null -> {
372                                }
373                                default -> {
374                                        // We ignore top level literals
375                                }
376                        }
377                }
378
379                private void flattenJsonObject(JSONObject jsonObject, String prefix, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
380                        for (String key : jsonObject.keySet()) {
381                                JSONValue value = jsonObject.get(key);
382                                String newKey = createObjectKey(prefix, key);
383                                dispatch(newKey, value, consumer);
384                        }
385                }
386
387                private void flattenJsonArray(JSONArray jsonArray, String prefix, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
388                        for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++) {
389                                JSONValue value = jsonArray.get(i);
390                                String newKey = createArrayKey(prefix, i);
391                                dispatch(newKey, value, consumer);
392                        }
393                }
394
395                private String createObjectKey(String prefix, String key) {
396                        String newKey = prefix.isEmpty() ? key : prefix + this.separator + key;
397                        return newKey;
398                }
399
400                private String createArrayKey(String prefix, int i) {
401                        return switch (arrayKeyOption) {
402                                case ARRAY -> prefix.isEmpty() ? String.valueOf(i) : prefix + "[" + i + "]";
403                                case DUPLICATE -> prefix.isEmpty() ? String.valueOf(i) : prefix;
404                        };
405                }
406
407                private void dispatch(String newKey, JSONValue value, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
408                        switch (value) {
409                                case JSONObject o -> flattenJsonObject(o, newKey, consumer);
410                                case JSONArray a -> flattenJsonArray(a, newKey, consumer);
411                                case JSONString s -> consumer.accept(newKey, s.value());
412                                case JSONBoolean b -> consumer.accept(newKey, String.valueOf(b.val()));
413                                case JSONNumber n -> consumer.accept(newKey, toString(n));
414                                case JSONNull n -> {
415                                }
416                        }
417                        ;
418                }
419
420                private String toString(JSONNumber number) {
421                        if (rawNumber) {
422                                return number.raw();
423                        }
424                        return String.valueOf(number.value());
425                }
426
427        }
428
429}
